phrases.usage: Use this structure to provide a concise summary of a person's primary character traits during an introduction.
phrases.example: She's kind and outgoing, so she makes friends easily because she enjoys attending social events.

phrases.usage: Use this phrase to specify a person's physical appearance, particularly when describing hair color or texture.
phrases.example: He has short curly hair, which makes him look quite youthful because of the style's texture.

phrases.usage: Use this expression to mention a consistent physical accessory that defines a person's daily appearance.
phrases.example: She wears glasses at work because she spends many hours analyzing complex data on her computer screen.

phrases.usage: Use this specific verb construction to identify a person's professional occupation or job title within a formal context.
phrases.example: He works as a graphic designer, so he spends his day creating visual content because he is highly imaginative.

phrases.usage: Use this frequency adverbial to explain a regular habit or a typical professional routine the person follows.
phrases.example: Most of the time, she works from home because her employer offers a flexible remote schedule.

phrases.usage: Use this emphatic structure to highlight and explain a specific quality you appreciate about your friend's character.
phrases.example: What I like most is his sense of humor because it helps everyone feel relaxed so the environment stays positive.

phrases.usage: Use this comparative phrase to analyze the differences in personality or habits between yourself and another person.
phrases.example: Compared to me, she is more organized, so she manages her time efficiently because she uses a digital planner.

keyVocabulary.definition: A character trait describing a person who is friendly and enjoys social interaction.
The ability to plan activities and handle tasks in an efficient and orderly way.
A professional who utilizes software and creativity to produce visual concepts and layouts.
The capacity to perceive, enjoy, or express what is amusing or comical.
To examine something in detail in order to understand its nature or determine its features.
